The 'Daily Express' (), founded on 3 September, 1998, is one of Pakistanâs most
widely circulated Urdu language newspapers, published by Century Publications, a
Lakson Group subsidiary. It is published simultaneously from Islamabad, Karachi,
Lahore, Peshawar, Quetta, Multan, Faisalabad, Gujranwala, Sargodha, Rawalpindi,
Rahim Yar Khan and Sukkar. It claims to have a 24% circulation share.
